intro: Cephaelis clausa, commonly known as the closed cephaelis, is a flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale pink. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
